meanings.definition: A number of people or things that are located close together or are considered or classed together.
meanings.sent1: During the field trip, our class formed a group to explore the museum together.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team is a group of players who practice and play matches together.
meanings.sent3: The group of ducks waddling in a line behind their mother looked like a little parade.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, a group of islands emerged like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The group of colorful balloons floating in the sky created a cheerful spectacle.

meanings.definition: A set of people with a shared characteristic or interest.
meanings.sent1: The book club is a group of avid readers who meet every week to discuss novels.
meanings.sent2: The hiking group enjoys exploring nature trails and climbing mountains together.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends who always wear matching hats to school is quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: In the library, a group of books on astronomy stood out among the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The group of musicians playing different instruments created a harmonious melody.
